intro: Cryptantha incana, commonly known as the hairy cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cryptantha incana is a perennial herb that is well adapted to arid environments.
